kimononet.peer

Class DefaultPeerEnvironment

  • java.lang.Object
    • kimononet.peer.PeerEnvironment
      • kimononet.peer.DefaultPeerEnvironment

  • public class DefaultPeerEnvironment
extends PeerEnvironment
     1. beacon-service-timeout: This value indicates how long in seconds a 
    beacon service waits for receiving a beacon from a neighbor before sending
    out its own beacon.
 2. max-beacon-peers: Maximum number of peers to be included in beacon 
    packets.
 3. node-failure-rate: With some frequency specified by this value, 
    nodes will completely shutdown. This allows simulation of hostile 
    environment.
 4. packet-loss-rate: Packets will be discarded on the receiving end at
    some frequency according to this value. For example 0.1 will indicate 10% 
    loss at each node.
 5. max-transmission-range: Packets above received further away than 
    this distance specified in meters will be discarded.
 6. average-gps-accuracy: Indicates the average value of some 
    distribution curve to be determined.
    Version:
    3/12/2012
    Author:
    Zorayr Khalapyan
